question: A twin engined aeroplane in cruise flight with one engine inoperative has to fly over high ground. In order to maintain the highest possible altitude the pilot should chooseâ€™.

choices.choice: the speed corresponding to the minimum value of lift / drag ratio.
the speed at the maximum lift.
the speed corresponding to the maximum value of the lift / drag ratio

subject: Performance

question: Two identical aeroplanes at different masses are descending at idle thrust. Which of the following statements correctly describes their descent characteristics?

choices.choice: At a given angle of attack, both the vertical and the forward speed are greater for the heavier aeroplane.
There is no difference between the descent characteristics of the two aeroplanes.
At a given angle of attack the heavier aeroplane will always glide further than the lighter aeroplane.
At a given angle of attack the lighter aeroplane will always glide further than the heavier aeroplane.

subject: Performance

question: Is there any difference between the vertical speed versus forward speed curves for two identical aeroplanes having different masses? (assume zero thrust and wind)

choices.choice: Yes, the difference is that the lighter aeroplane will always glide a greater distance.
Yes, the difference is that for a given angle of attack both the vertical and forward speeds of the heavier aeroplane will be larger.
Yes, the difference is that the heavier aeroplane will always glide a greater distance.

subject: Performance

choices.choice: increases the descent distance over ground
increases the angle of the descent flight path.

question: When descending at a constant Mach number:

choices.choice: The angle of attack remains constant.

subject: Performance

question: Which statement is correct for a descent without engine thrust at maximum lift to drag ratio speed?

choices.choice: The mass of an aeroplane does not have any effect on the speed for descent
The higher the gross mass the greater is the speed for descent
The higher the gross mass the lower is the speed for descent.
The higher the average tempwrature (OAT, the lower is the speed for descent.

subject: Performance

question: Which of the following factors leads to the maximum flight time of a glide?
subject: Performance

question: Which statements is correct for a descent without engine thrust at maximum lift to drag ratio speed?

choices.choice: A tailwind component increases fuel and time to descent
A tailwind component decreases the ground distance.
A tailwind component increases the ground distance.
A headwind component increases the ground distance.

subject: Performance

question: During a glide at constant Mach number , the pitch angle of the aeroplane will:

choices.choice: increase at first and decrease later on.

subject: Performance

question: Descending from cruising altitude to ground level at a constant IAS in a headwind, compared to still air conditions, will:

choices.choice: Reduce the fuel used in the descent.

subject: Performance

question: In a steady descending flight equilibrium of forces acting on the aeroplane is given by: (T=Thrust, D = Drag, W=Weight, descent angle = GAMMA)
subject: Performance

question: An aeroplane is in a power off glide at best gliding speed. If the pilot increases pitch attitude the glide distance.

choices.choice: may increase or decrease depending on the aeroplane

subject: Performance

question: An aeroplane executes a steady glide at the speed for minimum glide angle. If the forward speed is kept constant at VMD , what is the effect of a lower mass on the Rate of descent/ Glide angle/ CL/ CD ratio?
subject: Performance

question: What is the effect of increased mass on the performance of a gliding aeroplane at VMD?

choices.choice: The speed for best angle descent increases.

subject: Performance

question: Which of the following combinations has an effect on the angle of decent in a glide? (Ignore compressibility effects).
subject: Performance

question: Which of the following factors will lead to an increase of ground distance during a glide, while maintaining the appropriate minimum glide angle speed?
subject: Performance

question: With all engines out, a pilot wants to fly for maximum time, Therefore he has to fly the speed corresponding to:
subject: Performance

question: An aeroplane carries out a descent maintaining at a constant Mach number in the first part of the descent and then at a constant indicated airspeed in the second part of the descent. How does the angle of descent change in the first and in the second part of the descent? Assume idle thrust and clean configuration and ignore compressibility effects.

choices.choice: Increases in the first part; is constant in the second.
Increases in the first part; decreases in the second.
Is constant in the first part; decrease in the second.
Decreases in the first part; increases in the second.

subject: Performance

question: A twin jet aeroplane is in cruise, with one engine inoperative, and has to overfly a high terrain area. In order to allow the greatest height clearance, the appropriate airspeed must be the airspeed:
subject: Performance
